title: The Set-Up (1949) HDTV 720p
description:
The Set-Up (1949) <a href="
http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0041859" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0041859</a>

The Set-Up is the memorable, brutal story of washed-up boxer Stoker (Robert Ryan) as he fights the last fight of his career, a fight he is intended to lose. Directed with grim intensity by Robert Wise, and featuring a masterful, nuanced performance by Robert Ryan, the audience is taken into a nightmarish world where Ryan must face his own personal emotional demons as he battles with his own fears and searches for meaning in his life and his own personal integrity. Reminiscent of Raging Bull because of the intense realism of the boxing sequences, Ryan here shows himself to be one of the finest actors of the noir genre. Stoker, as portrayed by Ryan, is surrounded by parasites and hangers-on, but he, himself, has an unarticulated nobility that elevates his character to that of the seminal, existential hero. Ryan, perfectly suited for the role both in appearance and sensibility has never been finer. The Set-Up, because of its intense, unrelenting darkness and its emphasis on complex emotional themes is an unforgettable character study of a man on the edge, while at the same time an engrossing, deeply thoughtful examination of a man's battle for his own soul.
